title: How did Spider-Man get web fluid back in his web-shooters? - Quora

response.answer_text: When Peter invented his famous webshooters, he was very forward thinking. He knew that if he was mid swing, or mid fight and he ran out, he’d need to be able to “refill” quickly. Hell, if he HADNT thought of it before hand, it would have been shortly after his first outing after uncle Ben’s death, if not during one of his promotional appearances in the origin story. A simple google search will give you an example of a decent rendition of what he’s put together.  As you can see…it’s prettyndetailed. The wristband of his shooters carries a multitude of cartridges. Of course his BELT carries more as backup. Segmented similarly. This makes a quick mid swing, or mid fight cartridge change “quick” to say the least. Now, of course in the Sony movies, the first three, his “shooters” are organic. It’s like any other bodily fluid. Refills over time as needed. (Potentially distressing on his body/health). You’d think of the fluid like a full bladder of urine (gross) or sperm ejaculate? It’d be limited… i can imagine that each cartridge is filled with some sort of eye dropper device tho that’s an assumption. added: I mentioned the belt above, it’s more than just web cartridges…. as an example here.   It also includes space for a “signal” light to throw thugs and villains off their game, and room for his camera (one holds it in the back, the other to the side of the spider-signal/flashlight).
